answerText: Dirac equation[10] The Dirac equation is an analogue of the Klein-Gordon equation, which is also relativistic but only applies to particles with this value for the spin.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | University of North Carolina, Truman State A, and University of Toronto | 12 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Applying this relativistic extension of the Schrodinger equation to the hydrogen atom introduces the spin quantum number in a natural way.  [10] Identify this equation named for a British physicist which predicts the existence of antiparticles.
